headline: Local candidacy filings include auditor and Ohio Senate
author: Lorie Barber
sentences: Hagan, who has held various political positions in the past said he can’t side on the sidelines any longer as battle rages for “the future of our state, the soul of our nation and the very existence of democracy,” he said.
Also, Congressman Tim Ryan is set to file Monday to run for the Democratic nomination in the race to fill Ohio’s Senate seat being vacated by Republican Rob Portman.
I really feel, at this point, that I can represent the taxpayers better than anyone else interested in this role.
Ralph Meacham filed for Mahoning County Auditor and Bob Hagan filed to run for Ohio’s 33rd Senate District.
YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio (WKBN) – Two local candidates filed petitions Monday to run for office.
I intend to stay in this role and continue to serve the county, Meacham said.
“I really feel that I’m making a difference in the county.
Meacham will be seeking his third term in office.
He is challenging Republican Michael Rulli.
